title: An overview of the Horizon 2020 Work Programme 2014-2015 (LEIT-ICT)

author: Francesco Barbato, DG Communications Networks, Content and Technology (CNECT), European Commission

segmentation: So good afternoon everyone.
Last presentation of the European Data Forum before the closing remark.
I hope you're still awake, so we decided to keep this presentation as a last one, presenting finding opportunities from the European Commission.
Hope you will find this interesting so.

First of all, let me tell you that I really hope that this presentation will reflect many of the topics and issues that have been discussed during these two days, so I'm very proud to say that the European Commission for you know sometimes it's accused of not being relevant or not being time.
I think we're really on the ball on all these issues that we've touched upon years during these two days.

How do you define innovation?

So let's spend 30 seconds to read together actions primarily consisting of activities directly aiming at producing plants and arrangements, or designing for new, altered or improved products, processes or services for this purpose.

Include prototyping, testing, demonstrating, piloting, largest large scale product validation, and market replication so as you see here in this definition, there is no word that contains research, because innovation is not about research, it's about technology transfer or research results into products and services.
So this is what we mean by innovation actions under Horizon 2020.
Then what is the goal of ICT 15 year old goal is to make European companies more competitive in the big data environment.
In the data processing environment and we want to do this by deploying technologies that are mature enough to be flown into the commercial offer of European companies.

And this is the place where the reuse can happen.
